document.docTitle: Sinartoria damingshanensis Wang & Framenau & Zhang 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A further study on the wolf spider subfamily Artoriinae from China (Araneae: Lycosidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype
♂ (SWUC-T-LY-06-01), China ,
Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region
, Daming Mountain Nature Reserve , near the Erji hydropower station, 23°26.833′N , 108°27.883′E ,
927 m
,
21.V.2011
, Y.N. Wang & Y.Q. Peng leg.
Paratypes
( 4♂ and 8♀ ):
1♂ and 1♀ (SWUC-T-LY-06-02~03), with same data as holotype
;
1♀ (SWUC-T-LY-06-04), near Longteng Hotel of Mt. Daming , 23°29.933′N , 108°26.166′E ,
1169 m
,
7.VIII.2011
, C. Jing & J. Yang leg.
;
1♂ and 1♀ (SWUC-T-LY-06-05~06), Guanri Hill of Mt. Daming , 23°28.733′N , 108°26.100E ,
1391 m
,
27.V.2011
, Y.N. Wang & Y.Q. Peng leg.
;
1♀ (SWUC-T-LY-06-07), along the road of Mt. Daming , 23°24.016′N , 108°30.550′E ,
1035 m
,
23.V.2011
, Y.N. Wang & Y.Q. Peng leg.
;
2♀ (SWUC-T-LY-06-08~09), Shui- lin Peak of Mt. Daming , 23°24.016′N , 108°30.550′E ,
1030 m
,
9.VIII.2011
, C. Jing & J. Yang leg.
;
1♀ (SWUC-T- LY-06-10), Liugongli Administrative Station of Mt. Daming , 23°31.717′N , 108°19.850′E ,
211 m
,
12.VIII.2011
, C. Jing & J. Yang leg.
;
2♂ (SWUC-T-LY-06-11~12), Huansha Waterfall of Mt. Daming , 23°24.016′N , 108°30.550′E ,
1032 m
,
13.V.2011
, Y.N. Wang & Y.Q. Peng leg.
;
1♀ (SWUC-T-LY-06-13), near Longteng Hotel of Mt. Daming , 23°29.933′N , 108°26.166′E ,
1169 m
,
15.VII.2012
, C. Jing leg.
Etymology. The specific epithet is an adjective in apposition derived from the type locality.

Diagnosis. Male of
S. damingshanensis
sp. nov.
resembles
S. zhuangius
sp. nov.
( Figs 3–4 ), but can be distinguished from the latter by the following characters: three arms of median apophysis (AA, RA and PA) protruded, AA with several teeth ( Figs 1A , 2D, F , arms of median apophysis small and AA without teeth in the latter species, Figs 3A , 4E ); the sclerotized terminal apophysis (TA2) flame-shaped, slightly curved ( Figs 1A, C , 2D–H ), (villusshaped in the latter one ( Figs 3 , 4D–E ). Epigyne of the new species can be distinguished from other lycosids by a tongue-shaped septum, the compact spermathecal stalks and round spermathecal heads ( Figs 1D–E , 2I–J ).

Description. Male. Total length 4.80–5.20. Holotype ( Figs 2A, 2C ) total length 4.80. Carapace 2.59 long, 1.92 wide; opisthosoma 2.17 long, 1.45 wide. Eye sizes and interdistances: AME 0.08, ALE 0.08, PME 0.33, PLE 0.23; AME–AME 0.10, AME–ALE 0.10, PME–PME 0.25, PME–PLE 0.29. Clypeus 0.17 high. Leg measurements: I 7.52 (1.96, 2.54, 1.98, 1.04); II 6.61 (1.84, 2.16, 1.72, 0.89); III 6.18 (1.73, 2.01, 1.62, 0.82); IV 8.90 (2.37, 2.82, 2.56, 1.15).

Pedipalp (
Figs 1A – C
,
2D – H
). Median apophysis with three arms, AA, PA and RA. Embolus long and slender, its anterior part resting in a long groove of a large and complex terminal apophysis. Terminal apophysis with two arms, one of them membranous, as the functional conductor, the other one sclerotized and groove-like.

Female genitalia (
Figs 1D – E
,
2I –J
). Copulatory openings arc-shaped. Septum broad and tongue-shaped, the base is wider and tapered posteriorly. Spermathecal stalks compact and sclerotized, both are separated from each other by 1/3 distance of their radius. Spermathecal heads small with round end. Fertilization ducts crescent.
Distribution. Known only from around the type locality, Mt. Daming area, Guangxi of China ( Fig. 11 ).
